author: seamonkey82
content: Yes, besu is using `--sync-mode=X_CHECKPOINT`.  All non-default configuration parameters that can be defined on the command line are in the goerli.yml linked above.  prysm-besu was most recently re-synced after some invalid forkchoice issues which have since been resolved.

author: ajsutton
content: The next version of Teku will also support `--data-storage-mode=MINIMAL` which only keeps historic blocks as far back as required by the spec (~5 months) rather than all the way to genesis (and like `PRUNE` doesn't store finalized states).  It won't be the default but will get the consensus layer disk usage to be almost fixed size (around 42Gb on MainNet).

author: ajsutton
content: I believe Nimbus is looking at supporting block pruning too.

author: barnabasbusa
content: would this mean that theoretically eventually (if everyone starts using pruning), then nobody going to be able to sync from genesis?

author: ajsutton
content: Potentially yes. Though no one should be syncing from genesis either. That said we do need to build out ways to get these historic blocks to support creating archive nodes and for historic records etc.  The Nimbus team have done a bunch of work on that.

author: ajsutton
content: We've been holding off supporting block pruning since before genesis so that we'd get those systems setup, but it's a bit of a chicken and egg problem. Supporting block pruning but not making it default is basically cracking the egg to try and get the chicken moving....

author: ajsutton
content: Might have strained that analogy a bit too much...
